body_html:
Thanks for the thorough responses!

@goldsborough I'm not blocked, I can work around. I wanted some perspective on what we can rely on, and what we can't, and in case THCTensorMathReduce and its cousins were actually something you intended writers of C++ extensions to use, I wanted to make you aware that they were currently failing. Obviously the best long term solution is to get our code into upstream so that everything rolls forward together, and our code does not need to support different incarnations of the Torch libraries across different versions. In the meantime I will try to minimize my dependence on THC.

body:
Thanks for the thorough responses!

@goldsborough I'm not blocked, I can work around.  I wanted some perspective on what we can rely on, and what we can't, and in case THCTensorMathReduce and its cousins were actually something you intended writers of C++ extensions to use, I wanted to make you aware that they were currently failing.  Obviously the best long term solution is to get our code into upstream so that everything rolls forward together, and our code does not need to support different incarnations of the Torch libraries across different versions.  In the meantime I will try to minimize my dependence on THC.
